verses.roman:
eka eka phalera mūlya diyā cāri-cāri paṇa
daśa-krośa haite ānāya kariyā yatana

synonyms: eka eka phalera—of each and every fruit; mūlya—price; diyā—giving; cāri-cāri paṇa—four paṇas each (one paṇa equals twenty gaṇḍās); daśa-krośa—twenty miles away; haite—from; ānāya—brings; kariyā yatana—with great endeavor.
translation: "He collects coconut with great endeavor from a place twenty miles away, and he gives four paṇas each for them.
